Questions.QuestionString: 1. Which system providing communication within the aircraft?
Answers: A. The Cabin Intercommunication Data System (CIDS)
B. The Cabin Network Service (CNS)
C. The Cabin Inflight Entertaiment System (IFE)

Questions.QuestionString: 2. Which system providing communication between the aircraft cabin and ground stations?
Answers: A. The Cabin Intercommunication Data System (CIDS)
B. The Cabin Network Service (CNS)
C. The Cabin Inflight Entertaiment System (IFE)

Questions.QuestionString: 3. The Cabin Intercommunication Data System provides an interface between
Answers: A. Cockpit and cabin systems
B. Cabin crew and cabin systems
C. Cockpit/cabin crew and cabin systems

Questions.QuestionString: 4. Cabin Systems are used to communicate
Answers: A. Both within the aircraft cabin and between the cabin and the cockpit
B. Within the aircraft cabin
C. Between the cabin and the cockpit

Questions.QuestionString: 5. The Cabin Systems also include
Answers: A. System for inflight entertainment (IFE) of passengers.
B. System used by passengers to communicate with the ground.

C. Systems for inflight entertainment (IFE) of passengers, and systems used by passengers to
communicate with the ground.

Questions.QuestionString: 6. Older aircraft cabin systems used
Answers: A. digital electronics
B. analog electronics
C. Both analog and digital electronics

Questions.QuestionString: 7. A cabin intercommunication data system is used by
Answers: A. Flight attendants
B. Flight attendants and passengers
C. Flight attendants, pilots, and passengers

Questions.QuestionString: 8. A cabin network service is
Answers: A. A digital system that is typically hosted on a server within the aircraft
B. An analog system that is typically hosted on a server within the aircraft
C. A digital or analog system that is typically hosted on a server within the aircraft

Questions.QuestionString: 9. In Boeing 777. The cabin service system includes
Answers: A. both the cabin intercommunication data system and the inflight entertaiment system.
B. both the cabin intercommunication data system and the cabin network service.
C. both the cabin network service and the inflight entertaiment system.

Questions.QuestionString: 10. In Boeing 777. The cabin service system uses
Answers: A. Only one data bus system.
B. Two different data bus systems
C. Three different data bus systems

Questions.QuestionString: 11. The central processor of the Boeing 777 cabin service system is
Answers: A. The cabin systems management unit (CSMU)
B. The cabin central processor unit (CCPU)
C. The Directors

Questions.QuestionString: 12. The IFE equipment of each Boeing 777 passenger seat typically includes
Answers: A. A video display and an audio headphone jack.

B. A video display, an audio headphone jack, and controls for selecting specific video or audio content to
be enjoyed by the passenger.

C. A video display and controls for selecting specific video or audio content to be enjoyed by the
passenger.

Questions.QuestionString: 13. The data routes from the IFE computer to the individual passenger seats through.
Answers: A. The CSMU (Cabin systems management unit)
B. The ZMUs (Zone management units)
C. The CSMU and the ZMUs,

Questions.QuestionString: 14. The aircraft’s external communication system is used to connect with
Answers: A. A ground-based network.
B. A satellite-based network.
C. Either a ground-based network or a satellite-based network.

Questions.QuestionString:
15. For the aircraft’s external communication system connect with satellite-based network. The
antenna
Answers: A. Will be mounted on the lower surface of the aircraft, usually on the belly of the fuselage.
B. Will be mounted on the lower surface of the aircraft or on the upper surface of the aircraft
C. Must be mounted to the upper surface of the aircraft

Questions.QuestionString: 16. For the aircraft’s external communication system connect with ground-based network. The antenna
Answers: A. Will be mounted on the lower surface of the aircraft, usually on the belly of the fuselage.
B. Will be mounted on the lower surface of the aircraft or on the upper surface of the aircraft
C. Must be mounted to the upper surface of the aircraft

Questions.QuestionString: 17. Ground-based networks use
Answers: A. Internet to communicate with the aircraft.
B. Wired towers to communicate with the aircraft.
C. Radio towers to communicate with the aircraft.

Questions.QuestionString: 18. The cabin mass memory system is
Answers: A. Where allow controls the cabin system.
B. Where the data that is used in the cabin is stored.
C. Central processor of cabin system

Questions.QuestionString: 19. Which following statement is correct for cabin mass memory system?
Answers: A. The mass memory system can be programmed with cabin configuration information.
B. The mass memory system can not be programmed with cabin configuration information.
C. The mass memory system can be programmed with cockpit configuration information.

Questions.QuestionString: 20. Which following statement is correct for cabin mass memory system?
Answers: A. The system can not be updated.
B. The system can be updated, when necessary, through a data loading system.
C. The system can be automatically updated.

Questions.QuestionString: 21. Cabin monitoring systems are used to
Answers: A. Monitor the cabin crews.
B. Monitor the passenger in cabin.
C. Monitor various conditions in the passenger cabin.

Questions.QuestionString:
22. In the Cabin monitoring systems. Information about the conditions being monitored can be
accessed by
Answers: A. Passengers in real time.
B. Flight attendants in real time.
C. Maintenance staffs only

Questions.QuestionString:
23. In the Cabin monitoring systems. Information about the conditions can also be stored and accessed
later for
Answers: A. Troubleshooting
B. Trend monitoring
C. Purposes such as troubleshooting and trend monitoring.

Questions.QuestionString: 24. The cabin Wi-Fi, which allows passengers
Answers: A. To connect their own personal devices to an on-board Wi-Fi system.
B. To connect cabin system devices to an on-board Wi-Fi system.
C. To connect their own personal devices to cabin interphone system.

Questions.QuestionString:
25. Which systems support data exchange of the different related LRU’s and they are typically operated
via Flight Attendant Panels.
Answers: A. The Cabin Intercommunication Data System (CIDS)
B. The Cabin Inflight Entertaiment System (IFE)
C. The Cabin Network Service (CNS)

Questions.QuestionString: 26. Cabin Core System are include:
Answers: A. Inflight Entertainment System; External Communication System; Cabin Mass Memory System.
B. Inflight Entertainment System; External Communication System; Miscellaneous Cabin System.

C. Inflight Entertainment System; External Communication System; Cabin Mass Memory System; Cabin
Monitoring System; Miscellaneous Cabin System.

Questions.QuestionString: 27. Which system used for addressing passengers through overhead cabin speakers?
Answers: A. Cabin Interphone
B. Passenger Address
C. Flight Attendant Calling

Questions.QuestionString:
28. Which system used for communication among the cabin crew members, and also between the cabin
and the flight deck?
Answers: A. Flight Attendant Calling
B. Passenger Address
C. Cabin Interphone

Questions.QuestionString: 29. Which system allows passengers to call for assistance from the cabin crew?
Answers: A. Flight Attendant Calling
B. Cabin Interphone
C. Passenger Address

Questions.QuestionString: 30. Which system showing the aircraft’s current location, altitude, and airspeed
Answers: A. The Indication System
B. Moving Map Displays
C. The Display System

Questions.QuestionString: 31. A cabin network service is essentially
Answers: A. A cabin telephone
B. A cabin computer
C. A computer Local Area Network (LAN) within the aircraft

Questions.QuestionString: 32. Operation of thecabin network service wireless systems is
Answers: A. Not permitted during takeoffs and landings.
B. Not permitted during flight.
C. Not permitted during takeoffs.

Questions.QuestionString: 33. The three different data bus systems used in Boeing 777 cabin service system are
Answers: A. ARINC 629, the ARINC 429 and ARINC 628.
B. ARINC 629, the CSS Intersystem Bus and ARINC 628.
C. ARINC 429, the CSS Intersystem Bus, and ARINC 628.

Questions.QuestionString:
34. Which bus the Boeing 777 cabin service system connects to the aircraft information management
system (AIMS)?
Answers: A. The ARINC 629 bus
B. The CSS Intersystem Bus
C. The ARINC 628 bus

Questions.QuestionString:
35. Which bus is a data transfer bus internal to the cabin system in the Boeing 777 cabin service
system?
Answers: A. The ARINC 629 bus
B. The CSS Intersystem Bus
C. The data transfer bus

Questions.QuestionString:
36. Which bus is a data interface specifically designed for use with inflight entertainment (IFE) systems
in the Boeing 777 cabin service system?
Answers: A. The ARINC 628 bus
B. The CSS Intersystem Bus
C. The ARINC 429 bus

Questions.QuestionString: 37. The cabin systems management unit (CSMU) is connected to
Answers: A. The CSS Intersystem Bus
B. The aircraft’s main ARINC 429 data bus.
C. The aircraft’s main ARINC 629 data bus.

Questions.QuestionString: 38. The cabin systems management unit (CSMU) connects to the IFE system through
Answers: A. The ARINC 628 bus
B. The ARINC 429 bus
C. The aircraft’s main ARINC 429 data bus.

Questions.QuestionString: 39. Cabin attendant handsets (CAHs) are connected to
Answers: A. The cabin systems management unit (CSMU)
B. The cabin systems control panel (CSCP)
C. The zone management unit (ZMU)

Questions.QuestionString: 40. Cabin Networks can transfer large volumes of data to many different locations by using
Answers: A. Multiplexing and demultiplexing techniques
B. Modulation and demodulation techniques
C. Coding and decoding techniques

Questions.QuestionString: 41. Which PA announcements have higher priority?
Answers: A. Cabin Crew PA announcements
B. Pilot's PA announcements
C. Both Pilot's PA announcements and Cabin Crew PA announcements have same priority level

Questions.QuestionString: 42. The IFE equipment typically includes
Answers:
A. A video display, an audio headphone jack, and controls for selecting specific video or audio content to
be enjoyed by the passenger

B. A video display and controls for selecting specific video or audio content to be enjoyed by the
passenger
C. A controls for selecting specific video or audio content to be enjoyed by the passenger

Questions.QuestionString: 43. For connecting with the external networks, the aircraft uses
Answers: A. A router that is connected to dedicated radio transmitting equipment.
B. A router that is connected to dedicated radio receiving equipment.
C. A router that is connected to dedicated radio transmitting and receiving equipment.

Questions.QuestionString:
44. Which system can multiplex and de-multiplex many channels, and carry information to many
destinations simultaneously?
Answers: A. A low-speed digital data transfer system
B. A high-speed digital data transfer system
C. Both low and high-speed digital data transfer system

Questions.QuestionString: 45. The main advantage of the Iridium system is
Answers: A. The world-wide coverage capability
B. It not have disruptive connections
C. More cheap

Questions.QuestionString:
46. The Advantages of using WI-FI inside an aircraft cabin in comparison to hard-wired aircraft systems
are:
Answers:
A. Higher speed, easier and improved access to data and information and Hard points are eliminated
(Ethernet) for connection to the internet.

B. Better accessibility throughout the aircraft cabin and information and Hard points are eliminated
(Ethernet) for connection to the internet.

C. Higher speed, easier and improved access to data and information, Better accessibility throughout the
aircraft cabin and Hard points are eliminated (Ethernet) for connection to the internet.

Questions.QuestionString: 47. Which cameras essentially provide a real-time presentation of the aircraft's position for passengers?
Answers: A. Outside video cameras
B. Inside video cameras
C. All cameras

Questions.QuestionString:
48. Which cameras are commonly used and the video is usually incorporated in other flight data as part
of the individual passenger network displays?
Answers: A. Cabin Cameras and Cockpit door cameras
B. "Forward looking” and "down looking” cameras
C. All cameras
